subject: Technology
title: What Is an Algorithm, Really?
description: A quick win: understand What Is an Algorithm, Really?.

hook.text: Everyone blames the algorithm. Almost nobody can explain what one actually is.

buildup.text: An algorithm is simply a set of instructions for solving a problem. A recipe is an algorithm. So are driving directions.

discovery.text: Social media algorithms decide what you see by scoring every possible post and ranking them by predicted engagement.

twist.text: The algorithm doesn't know what's true, important, or good for you. It only knows what keeps you scrolling longer.

climax.text: Understanding algorithms is essential because invisible software now decides what billions of people see, think, and believe.

punchline.text: An algorithm is just instructions. These ones shape reality for billions.

quiz.question: What does a social media algorithm optimize for?
options: Keeping users engaged and scrolling longer
Showing the most recent posts first
